content.text: AngularJS Routing
The ngRoute module helps your application to become a Single Page Application.
content.html: The ngRoute module helps your application to become a Single Page Application.

content.text: What is Routing in AngularJS?
If you want to navigate to different pages in your application, but you also want the application to be a SPA (Single Page Application), with no page reloading, you can use the ngRoute module.
content.html: If you want to navigate to different pages in your application, but you also want the application to be a SPA (Single Page Application), with no page reloading, you can use the ngRoute module.

content.text: The ngRoute module routes your application to different pages without reloading the entire application.
content.html: The ngRoute module routes your application to different pages without reloading the entire application.

content.code:
Main

Red Green Blue
content.code_html:
<body ng-app="myApp">

<p><a href="#/!">Main</a></p>

<a href="#!red">Red</a>
<a href="#!green">Green</a>
<a href="#!blue">Blue</a>

<div ng-view></div>

<script>
var app = angular.module("myApp", ["ngRoute"]);
app.config(function($routeProvider) {
  $routeProvider
  .when("/", {
    templateUrl : "main.htm"
  })
  .when("/red", {
    templateUrl : "red.htm"
  })
  .when("/green", {
    templateUrl : "green.htm"
  })
  .when("/blue", {
    templateUrl : "blue.htm"
  });
});
</script>
</body>

content.text: What do I Need?
To make your applications ready for routing, you must include the AngularJS Route module:
content.html: To make your applications ready for routing, you must include the AngularJS Route module:

content.code_html: <script src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/angularjs/1.6.9/angular-route.js"></script>

content.text: Then you must add the ngRoute as a dependency in the application module:
content.html: Then you must add the ngRoute as a dependency in the application module:

content.code_html: var app = angular.module("myApp", ["ngRoute"]);

content.text: Now your application has access to the route module, which provides the $routeProvider .
content.html: Now your application has access to the route module, which provides the $routeProvider.

content.text: Use the $routeProvider to configure different routes in your application:
content.html: Use the $routeProvider to configure different routes in your application:

content.code_html:
app.config(function($routeProvider) {
  $routeProvider
  .when("/", {
    templateUrl : "main.htm"
  })
  .when("/red", {
    templateUrl : "red.htm"
  })
  .when("/green", {
    templateUrl : "green.htm"
  })
  .when("/blue", {
    templateUrl : "blue.htm"
  });
});

content.text: Where Does it Go?
Your application needs a container to put the content provided by the routing.
content.html: Your application needs a container to put the content provided by the routing.

content.text: This container is the ng-view directive.
content.html: This container is the ng-view directive.

content.text: There are three different ways to include the ng-view directive in your application:
content.html: There are three different ways to include the ng-view directive in your application:

content.code_html: <div ng-view></div>
<ng-view></ng-view>
<div class="ng-view"></div>

content.text: Applications can only have one ng-view directive, and this will be the placeholder for all views provided by the route.
content.html: Applications can only have one ng-view directive, and this will be the placeholder for all views provided by the route.

content.text: $routeProvider
With the $routeProvider you can define what page to display when a user clicks a link.
content.html: With the $routeProvider you can define what page to display when a user clicks a link.

content.code_html:
var app = angular.module("myApp", ["ngRoute"]);
app.config(function($routeProvider) {
  $routeProvider
  .when("/", {
    templateUrl : "main.htm"
  })
  .when("/london", {
    templateUrl : "london.htm"
  })
  .when("/paris", {
    templateUrl : "paris.htm"
  });
});

content.text: Define the $routeProvider using the config method of your application. Work registered in the config method will be performed when the application is loading.
content.html: Define the $routeProvider using the config method of your application. Work registered in the config method will be performed when the application is loading.

content.text: Controllers
With the $routeProvider you can also define a controller for each "view".
content.html: With the $routeProvider you can also define a controller for each "view".

content.code_html:
var app = angular.module("myApp", ["ngRoute"]);
app.config(function($routeProvider) {
  $routeProvider
  .when("/", {
    templateUrl : "main.htm"
  })
  .when("/london", {
    templateUrl : "london.htm",
    controller : "londonCtrl"
  })
  .when("/paris", {
    templateUrl : "paris.htm",
    controller : "parisCtrl"
  });
});
app.controller("londonCtrl", function ($scope) {
  $scope.msg = "I love London";
});
app.controller("parisCtrl", function ($scope) {
  $scope.msg = "I love Paris";
});

content.text: The "london.htm" and "paris.htm" are normal HTML files, which you can add AngularJS expressions as you would with any other HTML sections of your AngularJS application.
content.html: The "london.htm" and "paris.htm" are normal HTML files, which you can add AngularJS expressions as you would with any other HTML sections of your AngularJS application.

content.text: The files looks like this:
content.html: The files looks like this:

content.code:
London

London is the capital city of England.

It is the most populous city in the United Kingdom, with a metropolitan area of over 13 million inhabitants.

{{msg}}
content.code_html:
<h1>London</h1>
<h3>London is the capital city of England.</h3>
<p>It is the most populous city in the United Kingdom, with a metropolitan area of over 13 million inhabitants.</p>
<p>{{msg}}</p>

content.code:
Paris

Paris is the capital city of France.

The Paris area is one of the largest population centers in Europe, with more than 12 million inhabitants.

{{msg}}
content.code_html:
<h1>Paris</h1>
<h3>Paris is the capital city of France.</h3>
<p>The Paris area is one of the largest population centers in Europe, with more than 12 million inhabitants.</p>
<p>{{msg}}</p>

content.text: Template
In the previous examples we have used the templateUrl property in the $routeProvider.when method.
content.html: In the previous examples we have used the templateUrl property in the $routeProvider.when method.

content.text: You can also use the template property, which allows you to write HTML directly in the property value, and not refer to a page.
content.html: You can also use the template property, which allows you to write HTML directly in the property value, and not refer to a page.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
"

Main

Click on the links to change this content

"

syntax_highlighting.text:
"

Main

Click on the links to change this content

"

content.code_html:
var app = angular.module("myApp", ["ngRoute"]);
app.config(function($routeProvider) {
  $routeProvider
  .when("/", {
    template : "<h1>Main</h1><p>Click on the links to change this content</p>"
  })
  .when("/banana", {
    template : "<h1>Banana</h1><p>Bananas contain around 75% water.</p>"
  })
  .when("/tomato", {
    template : "<h1>Tomato</h1><p>Tomatoes contain around 95% water.</p>"
  });
});

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
"

Main

Click on the links to change this content

"

content.text: The otherwise method
In the previous examples we have used the when method of the $routeProvider .
content.html: In the previous examples we have used the when method of the $routeProvider.

content.text: You can also use the otherwise method, which is the default route when none of the others get a match.
content.html: You can also use the otherwise method, which is the default route when none of the others get a match.

content.code_html:
var app = angular.module("myApp", ["ngRoute"]);
app.config(function($routeProvider) {
  $routeProvider
  .when("/banana", {
    template : "<h1>Banana</h1><p>Bananas contain around 75% water.</p>"
  })
  .when("/tomato", {
    template : "<h1>Tomato</h1><p>Tomatoes contain around 95% water.</p>"
  })
  .otherwise({
    template : "<h1>None</h1><p>Nothing has been selected</p>"
  });
});
